intro: Campylospermum laeve, commonly known as the smooth campylospermum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, often glabrous stems and lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. The species is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
